article.title: DEEProtect: Enabling Inference-based Access Control on Mobile Sensing Applications

multiple_choice_question.text: What does DEEProtect aim to achieve in terms of user inferences?
choices: Block all inferences from sensor data.
Allow all inferences from sensor data.
Allow only useful inferences while hindering sensitive inferences.
Enhance all inferences, both useful and sensitive.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the blue area in the Venn diagram (Figure 2(a)-3) represent?
choices: Information relevant only to useful inferences.
Information relevant only to sensitive inferences.
Information irrelevant to both useful and sensitive inferences.
Information relevant to both useful and sensitive inferences.

multiple_choice_question.text: What are the three stages of DEEProtect's data obfuscation pipeline?
choices: Data minimization, feature obfuscation, data reconstruction.
Data collection, data sharing, data analysis.
Data encryption, data transmission, data decryption.
Data blocking, data mocking, data shadowing.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the privacy budget '€' in the  €-LDP definition represent?
choices: The amount of noise added to the data.
The level of privacy guaranteed by the algorithm.
The size of the dataset being analyzed.
The complexity of the inferences being made.
